metadata.Title: CVE-2020-10188 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
utility.c in telnetd in netkit telnet through 0.17 allows remote attackersto execute arbitrary code via short writes or urgent data, because of abuffer overflow involving the netclear and nextitem functions.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-10188` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

telnet - 0.17-44build1
telnetd - 0.17-44build1
No subscription required

inetutils-ftp - 2:1.9.4-12
inetutils-ftpd - 2:1.9.4-12
inetutils-inetd - 2:1.9.4-12
inetutils-ping - 2:1.9.4-12
inetutils-syslogd - 2:1.9.4-12
inetutils-talk - 2:1.9.4-12
inetutils-talkd - 2:1.9.4-12
inetutils-telnet - 2:1.9.4-12
inetutils-telnetd - 2:1.9.4-12
inetutils-tools - 2:1.9.4-12
inetutils-traceroute - 2:1.9.4-12
No subscription required

criterions.comment: netkit-telnet package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.17-44build1').
netkit-telnet-ssl package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
inetutils package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:1.9.4-12').
